00037 /**
00038  * \file sequenceP.h
00039  * \brief Private declarations for the \ref Sequence module.
00040  *
00041  * $Source: /usr/local/Repositories/fcdmf/fclib/modules/sequenceP.h,v $
00042  * $Revision: 1.14 $ 
00043  * $Date: 2006/08/30 19:20:01 $
00044  */
00045 
00046 #ifndef _FC_SEQUENCE_P_H_
00047 #define _FC_SEQUENCE_P_H_
00048 
00049 #ifdef __cplusplus
00050 extern "C" {
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 // include these in basic data structures to simplify includes for the
00054 // the rest of the library which won't ever use them
00055 #include "tableP.h"
00056 #include "fileio.h"
00057 #include "fileioP.h"
00058 
00059 /**
00060  * \ingroup  PrivateSequence
00061  *
00062  * \brief Sequence Slot Structure for the Sequence Table
00063  *
00064  * \description 
00065  *
00066  *   This structure contains meta data and big data for a sequence. A sequence
00067  *   is an ordered series which is orthogonal to the spatial dimensions of the
00068  *   meshes. The most common type of sequence is a time series where the
00069  *   coordinates of the series are the time values. Besides the information
00070  *   stored in the header (see _FC_SlotHeader), this struct has a handle for
00071  *   the owning dataset and a structure containing file IO info. It also stores
00072  *   the coordinates of the sequence which are assumed to be 1D.
00073  */
00074 typedef struct {
00075   _FC_SlotHeader header;  /**< Header, which contains general purpose info. */
00076   FC_Dataset ds;      /**< Handle to the owning dataset. */
00077   //---File reference
00078   _FC_SeqFileIOInfo fileInfo; /**< Holds info pertinent to file access. */
00079   //---About the sequence:  coordinates
00080   int numStep;        /**< The number of steps in this sequence (e.g. the 
00081                 number of time steps). */
00082   FC_DataType datatype;  /**< The data type of the sequence coords (e.g. int, 
00083                             float, etc.). */
00084   void *coords;       /**< Big Data: the coordinate values (assumed 1D). */
00085 } _FC_SeqSlot;
00086 
00087 // slot methods
00088 void _fc_initSeqSlot(_FC_SeqSlot* seqSlot);
00089 void _fc_releaseSeqSlot(_FC_SeqSlot *seqSlot);
00090 void _fc_clearSeqSlot(_FC_SeqSlot *seqSlot);
00091 
00092 // table access
00093 int _fc_getSeqTableSize(void);
00094 _FC_SeqSlot* _fc_getNewSeqSlot(void);
00095 _FC_SeqSlot* _fc_getSeqSlot(FC_Sequence sequence);
00096 _FC_SeqSlot* _fc_getSeqSlotFromID(int seqID);
00097 FC_ReturnCode _fc_deleteSeqSlot(FC_Sequence sequence);
00098 void _fc_printSeqTable(char *label);
00099 void _fc_freeSeqTable(void);
00100 
00101 #ifdef __cplusplus
00102 }
00103 #endif
00104 
00105 #endif // _FC_SEQUENCE_P_H_
